reviewText: Not what I expected.  They are too hard trying to sell their Institute and the actual program of being a "futurist".  I would recommend you try it before you buy it.

If you just take 1 course in the whole specialization, then Coursera keeps on charging you monthly for the "subscription" without being clear about the terms.  I would've taken more courses with this platform, but this was clear and plain fraud. I'm erasing my account and my employees'. It's amazing how abusive companies turn when they're having high demand for their products. Let me use my Futures Thinking skills: I see this platform as the Netscape of browsers. Your employees will leave and create better, hopefully more ethical, online learning companies.

Too much reading an not enough video tuturials.  If I wanted to read I would have gotten a book.  It did not feel virtual enough for me.  The content felt like it was the same thing repeated in many of the articles we had to read.  This easily could have been covered in a one hour video instead of a full day plus class.
ninguna

A big chunk of the course is dedicated to tell how important a certain set of skills is, and what you could learn in the next courses; not in discussing what constitues these skills or presenting tools in which to use they are important.
users: Eurick Dimitri C. F da Silva

reviewText: It's a fun course but not one I'd pay to take. It felt like a big advertisement for the other courses in this series. I suppose that they DID need to explain what future's thinking is before diving deeper, but it's not like it's some rocket science concept. But it was a fun course nonetheless.
Bad
It's a nice one but I didn't get engaged, i felt is not what i was looking for . THANK YOU ANYWAY

very interesting topic
Bien

Great course, loved the material and examples and how it was structured.  Needs updating especially post COVID!I was disappointed by the quality of other participants who didn't even bother with the assignments, let alone starting any interesting discussions.  But I guess that's usual with MOOCs!

Some students are not taking the writing assignments seriously and we get punished for flagging them as incomplete even though I have reviewed them. Suggest if we flag something it should count as a review and maybe don't allow both reviews to be flagged.
Thank you!
perfect
A very good introduction into futures thinking, but it´s just that; an introduction i suggest a lot to take the entire course.

Que bien! por fin termine este curso y mi mente se siente mas ligera y me siento capaz de abrir mi mente e imaginar las posibilidades del futuro. Espero mejorar con el paso de los demás cursos. He tenido una experiencia increíble!
Great introduction course, provides overview and perspective!

Overall I enjoyed this course and appreciated the combined use of videos (with a variety of speakers) and readings.  I thought the assignments were helpful in providing practical experience with the approach and tools presented.  My only critiques are that a)at times it felt more like a series of commercials to market futures thinking (and perhaps IFTF by extension) and b)there was an overemphasis on the technocratic side of futures thinking with barely any passing references to how social dynamics and politics should be considered alongside technological advances when thinking about how future signals may play out.
Good introduction. It could be shortened, though, into 2 weeks.

Peer review process is flawed and should not be a score-generating or gating process. I am stuck trying to finish a course because one assignment was graded incorrectly by a reviewer who is not using the rubric correctly.

Excellent instructor, outstanding content, and super relevant subject manner.  I am very thankful I found this course.  This is phenomenal.
Great class!
Really interesting course about the tools of foresight- lightweight, lively and interesting, with clear and satisfying assignments. Looking forward to the next course!
Excellent course. Opened my eyes so wide to the future and all its many possibilities.

This is the most comprehensive course on Futures Thinking available online. I work in Innovation Consulting and so looking at trends and shifts is a key aspect of my job. I have no formal education in this area and have found this course has moved my thinking on about foresight in a significant way. For one, I thought of this skills as a specialist practitioner skill but it clear that this is a skill we all can use to create the future we want. I have particularly found the assignments very interesting and its gotten me to think about the futures domains I am passionate about which are the Future of Aging and the Future of Work and learning, which are somewhat interlinked. The instructor Jane McGonigal is a rockstar in her own field of game design and an amazing presenter. I have signed up for more than 20 courses on Coursera over the years and this has to be the best in terms of content quality and delivery. Some feedback for the course creators, if I had to find an area more improvement it with with the IFTF Research Director paired conversations, the pace felt slow and the interviewer repeated too much of what was being said by the interviewee.
Completely worth the time and content. It helps you to explore future possibilities with a better framework and science coming directly from practitioners in the field.
It was a wonderful course. A great introduction to future thinking and how to apply it in the real world.
Very nice course, kept me engaged from the start, and motivate me to go for whole specialisation. Thanks.

I had best expectations, since I know and appreciate the work of Jane McGonigal and the Institute for Future - but I was even more inspired and enlightened. Now I want to make even more! And I want to be a member of the Institute.
A perfect start to become a futures professional.

Great introduction course about futures thinking. Clear and concrete tools, easily explained and practical examples. I only wish we had more feedback, or a thorough one and mostly, and what I really need is feedback from the experts from IFTF
This is a truly fabulous course. Very positive with a lot of practical tools to aid futures thinking as a way of life.
Just amazing!

A fantastic introduction that manages to capture the polarities of the practical/understandable with the philosophical/theoretical. It should be a huge hit and I suspect many will want to continue their futures studies!
Great content!
Very interested course.  Learned more about Futures thinking than I expected.
Interesting course on how to see signals and drivers for a potential future.
Very good course. Concrete, practical and well thought out. Fascinating subject matter. Amazing to have virtual access through this platform to Silicon Valley's cutting edge thinking!
